Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Continuous Pressure Monitoring in Regional Anesthesia

Trial_Design.evidence: randomisation at the interfascial space level

Intervention.evidence: A custom-built pressure monitoring system continuously measured saline injection pressure during ultrasound-guided regional block procedures.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates whether continuous monitoring of injection pressure can differentiate interfascial spaces from surrounding structures in a porcine model.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Mean intramuscular pressure was significantly higher than mean interfascial pressure

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomisation at the interfascial space level

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean intramuscular pressure was significantly higher than mean interfascial pressure (p < 1 × 10^−13).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by grant RW/36/25.
